text: Zefta (زفتا) is a village in Nabatieh District, southern Lebanon. ==History== In the 1596 tax records, it was named as a village, Zafta, in the Ottoman nahiya (subdistrict) of Sagif under the liwa' (district) of Safad, with a population of 17 households and 4 bachelors, all Muslim. The villagers paid a fixed tax-rate of 25 % on agricultural products, such as wheat, barley, fruit trees, goats and beehives, in addition to "occasional revenues" and a press for olive oil or grape syrup; a total of 1,740 akçe.Hütteroth and Abdulfattah, 1977, p. 186Note that Rhode, 1979, p. 6 writes that the register that Hütteroth and Abdulfattah studied was not from 1595/6, but from 1548/9 In 1875, Victor Guérin found here a village with 200 Metuali inhabitants.Guérin, 1880, p. 517 == References == ==Bibliography== * * * ==External links== *Zefta, Localiban Category:Populated places in Nabatieh Governorate Category:Populated places in Lebanon Category:Shia Muslim communities in Lebanon Category:Nabatieh District
title: Zefta, Lebanon
